casebody.data:
Hobby against Smith. A circuit judge cannot attorney r 811 And, there-papers^upon him, in a cause wherein, before his appointment, he was attorney, is irregular. S. H. Foot,

moved for judgment as in case of nonsuit,

J- A. Spencer,

contra, objected, that notice of the motion had been served on the Hon. William Kelson, formerly attorney in the cause, since his appointment to the office f Circuit Judge. He cited Given v. Driggs.(a)

Foot.

This does not prevent his practicing as attorney.

3 Caines' Rep. 150.

 Curia.

It was held otherwise by the Court of Errors, at their last September term. They decided that a Circuit jucjge could not act as counsel in that Court.

Motion denied;
